availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Ham (Fleming County, Kentucky, teacher)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, teacher. Fleming County native. Son of William Ham and Missey Ham. Married to Eliza Jones Fleming on December 3, 1857. Father of Marietta Ham. Laborer in Fleming County in 1850. Teacher in Fleming County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2, p. 383. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 128. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910) Fleming County, Marriages, 1857, Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
